com.camerontec.catalys.util.collection.persisted

Class IOHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.collection.persisted.IOHelper

  • public class IOHelper
extends Object
    This class consists of some static methods to help serialize and deserialize Objects.

      • read

        public static final byte[] read(InputStream in,
                                int length)
                         throws IOException
        Read a specified number of bytes from an input stream.
        Parameters:
        in - inputStream to read from.
        length - number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        a byte array of size length populated with data from the given input stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading from the input stream.

                                int length)
                         throws IOException

        Parameters:
        dis - dataInputStream to read from.
        length - number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        a byte array of size length populated with data from the given data input stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading from the data input stream.

        Parameters:

        offset - into the byte array.
        Returns:
        the int the int represented in the byte array.
        See Also:

        Converts a byte to a boolean.
        Parameters:

        offset - into the array.
        Returns:

      • writeString

        public static final void writeString(String str,
                                     OutputStream out)
                              throws IOException
        Write a String as a 4 byte[] indicating the length followed by the byte data of the string itself.
        Parameters:
        str - a string to write.
        out - the output stream to which to write the string.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem writing the string length or string to the output stream.

      • writeString

        public static void writeString(String str,
                               DataOutputStream dos,
                               boolean flush)
                        throws IOException
        Write a String as a 4 byte[] indicating the length followed by the byte data of the string itself.

        This method is potentially more efficient than writeString(java.lang.String, java.io.OutputStream) when multiple writes are required to the same underlying data output stream.

        Parameters:
        str - The string to write.
        dos - The data output stream.
        flush - True to flush the data output stream, false not to do so.
        Throws:
        IOException - If there is a problem writing the string length or string to the output stream.

      • readString

        public static final String readString(InputStream in)
                               throws IOException
        Read a String as a 4 byte[] as the length followed by the String as byte data.
        Parameters:
        in - the input stream from which to read the string.
        Returns:
        the next string in the input stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the string.

      • readString

        public static final String readString(DataInputStream dis)
                               throws IOException
        Read a String as a 4 byte[] as the length followed by the String as byte data.
        Parameters:
        dis - the data input stream from which to read the string.
        Returns:
        the next string in the input stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the string.

      • readString

        public static final String readString(byte[] buf,
                                      int offset)
        Read a String as a 4 byte[] as the length followed by the String as byte data.
        Parameters:
        buf - the byte array source.
        offset - the offset into the buffer.
        Returns:
        the string found at the given offset into the buffer.

      • bytesToNumericString

        public static final String bytesToNumericString(byte[] buf,
                                                int offset,
                                                int length)
        Display a byte array in a readable format.
        Parameters:
        buf - a byte array.
        offset - an offset into the byte array.
        length - the number of bytes to display.
        Returns:
        a readable representation of the specified bytes in the array.

      • writeObject

        public static final byte[] writeObject(Object data)
                                throws IOException
        Because Serialization can be slow, this method converts an Object into a byte array. If the Object has a specialized toBytes() method we use that, otherwise we just serialize it using the traditional java serialization.
        Parameters:
        data - the object to serialize.
        Returns:
        a byte array representation of the given object.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem serializing the given object.

      • readObject

        public static final Object readObject(byte[] buf,
                                      int offset)
                               throws IOException,
                                      ClassNotFoundException
        Because Serialization can be slow, this method converts a byte array to an Object. If the Object has a specialized fromBytes() method we use that, otherwise we just serialize it using the traditional java serialization.
        Parameters:
        buf - buffer to read from.
        offset - into the buffer.
        Returns:
        the object represented in the given byte array.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        ClassNotFoundException - if the class of the object being deserialized does not exist
